states.2: 5 or more apical spines per lobe

states.1: long, longer than 1/2 of the telson length
states.2: short-to mid sized, at most 0.4 telson length

states.1: subrounded, posterior and ventral corner always convex, postero-ventral corner sometimes marked only with seta
states.2: angular, ventral margin slightly convex, posterior margin straight or concave, postero-ventral corner always distinct
two or more setae and/or spines dorso-postero-laterally

states.1: with 7 spines, typically inner with several denticle and other with at most three denticles
states.2: with 7 spines, inner four with several denticles, the outer three can have less than three denticles
states.3: with 7 spines, all with several denticles
states.4: more than 7 spines, all fine pectinated forming combs

9.description: propodus and carpus of gnathopods I - II

states.1: carpus longer than propodus, propods elongated and small
states.2: carpus as long as propodus or shorter, propodus mid-sized and of quadratic shape
states.3: carpus as long as propodus or shorter, propodus large and in a shape of a hoof

states.1: much larger than propodus of gnathopod I, larger than head capsulae
states.2: slightly larger than propodus of gnathopod I, at most of the size of head capsulae
more than one seta on outer margin

states.1: at most one spine at the base of the nail
states.2: at least one additional spine in addition to the spine at the base of the nail (some polymorphism may exist, e.g., left-right assymetry, spines not on all appendages)

states.1: much deeper than broad, proximally with deep excavation
states.2: more broad than deep, or as broad as deep, or slightly deeper than broad, but never with deep proximal excavation

states.1: long and slender, longer than 1/2 of propodus length
states.2: slender or stout, at most 1/2 of propodus length

states.1: distal setae on rami not remarkably longer than spines
states.2: long setae distally on rami (broom-like appearance)

states.1: inner ramus slightly to remarkably longer than outer ramus in both sexes
states.2: inner ramus shorter than outer ramus in both sexes

states.1: sexually dimorphic: inner ramus elongated and measures 1.3¨C2.0 of outer ramus in males. Females with subequal rami.
states.2: sexually non-dimorphic: the ratio between inner and outer ramus is roughly the same both sexes

states.1: sexually dimorphic: distal article of expopodite in males elongated and measures 0.3¨C1.0 of proximal article. In females and juvenile individuals at most 0.1 of proximal article.
states.2: sexually non-dimorphic: distal article of expodite at most 0.1 of proximal article in both sexes
